result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry J. Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: On or Near a Park], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
COMMENCE FORTHWITH
AMENDED TO READ  
**COURT APPROVES the deft's request; 10% of the money be taken out of the deft's State pay but NOT the money he receives from his family.**

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Pay DNA surcharge.    
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days. PD - Aileen Henry

$ taken from state pay only

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared via telephone.  Deft does not object to money be taken out of his State pay for financial obligations but OBJECTS to any money being taken out of the money he receives from his family.  Court approves the deft's request; 10% may be taken from the deft's State pay but NOT the money he receives from his family.
Telephone conference on April 2, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
From DOC Oakhill Corrections requesting clarification if DE should be paying towards financial obligations to judge for decision.
Amended to read 5 years ES
To date - no response received from DA's office regarding Jan 8th fax from DOC.  Per Court - amend JOC to 18mos initial confinement followed by 5yrs of ES.
Per Court - send a copy of DOC's Jan 8th fax to DA's office inviting comments w/in 15 days
Fax received from DOC re: requesting court to review the JOC dated 11/3/14; ES does not meet the statutory requirements
Extended Supervision Conditions-Ordered by the Court-
7yrs 6mos WSP; initial confinement of 18mos followed by 6yrs of ES.  Deft not eligible for CIP or ERP

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 7yrs 6mos WSP; initial confinement of 18mos followed by 6yrs of ES.  See conditions.  Credit for 230 days.  Appeal rights.  Deft not eligible for CIP or ERP.

SWE filed on 03-24-14 transferred from 14GF4000x
KPD Case No. 14-031711

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Henry.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 11/3/14 @ 3pm
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Jeremy Chavez (on behalf of Atty Aileen Henry).  FPT 8/29/14 @ 11am, JT 9/22/14 @ 9am

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jeremy Chavez for Attorney Aileen Henry.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:34am-  Attorney Henry previously made a request to the clerk that this case be adjourned as she was recently appointed & had not received the file from previous counsel yet.  Court notes that the motion to withdraw for previous counsel was granted on 5/1/2014 & it took the Public Defender's office approximately 8 weeks to appoint new counsel.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 09:30 am.  Bond continued.
Atty Aileen Henry
Defendant's Demand for Discovery & Witness List - filed by DE, pro se   (Copy sent to DA's Office & Attorney Lassiter on 6/13/2014)
Status conference on July 2, 2014 at 08:45 am.
5/23/2014 Status conference is rescheduled to 7/2/2014 at 8:45am - Public Defender's office did not appoint new counsel.  NTBS by the Court.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:30am-  Attorney Lassiter motions to withdraw due to conflict of interest previously mentioned.  Motion to withdraw as counsel is granted effective upon new appointment of public defender.  Status conference adjourned to May 23, 2014 at 08:45 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:09am-  Attorney Lassiter is requesting a status conference as she may have a conflict.  There is another defendant that is not listed as a co-defendant but the charges are from the same incident.  Discussion held.  Court grants request.  Status conference scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Carmen Lassiter. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Krejcarek.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 4-10-14 @ 8:30am. Bond continued.

to Preliminary Hearing
